TopicTitle: Why would you be a terrible space colonist?

Articles.Content:
Reading about Scott Kelly's year in space I realized I would not be a happy space camper. My main weakness (aside from totally not being an astronaut)? I love cooking and eating fresh food too much. I couldn't make it on space grub.

Why wouldn't you be able to live in space?
I have psoriasis and would clog up the air filters.

Claustrophobia might do me in. I don't mind enclosed spaces...even really unpleasantly cramped ones...for moderate periods of time, but over the course of months it might drive me batty. 

Cooking is a big deal but I could get by.

I'm overweight. But I'm in the process of fixing that.

Other than that...oh, yeah, I dropped out of highschool because I loved developing video games too damn much.
That might actually be a good thing, I suppose things will need programming on Mars?
I love meat way to much. Hard to get on mars...
I would be the most awesome space colonist ever. I would make hot coco for my crew mates, organise neat board game evenings (gravity not included) and knit sweaters out of asteroids for everyone.
Because I'm too lazy and an expert procrastinator. No, really, I'll fix the space toilet and the air purifier/generator tomorrow...
Because I love blowing up the spacecraft too much! (I'm not joking) Now that's a Kerbal weakness if I ever heard of one!

I'm picky...

Oh and we all play KSP.

I'm an idiot. (I might accidentally flip the wrong switch on an airlock door.)

I'm lazy. (I might say "Eh, we've got 2 days until the air bleed becomes a problem. I'll fix it tomorrow...")

I'm extremely introverted. (The Station Commander will learn about this through email, and I'll probably ignore his texts.)

But most importantly, I'm brutally honest. (I'll tell the recruitment guys the above and they probably won't send me up to begin with.)

 

Definitely not Space Colonist material.

Oh yeah, and with my fix-it skills, I usually have to take something half-apart again when it's almost together because I realize that I forgot to put this piece in. Like, almost always, my wife is so used to it that if I don't have to take something apart again she asks "Are you sure you didn't forget something?"

I have a wife. She's not interested in going to Mars.
I'd probably snore in zero-G. Chances of me making it to Mars without being murdered by irate sleepless crewmates, mulched, and recycled into fertilizer are about zero.

I'm a lazy procrastinator who suffers from claustrophobia when stuck in a group of people. I also need silence in my life, so a noisy spaceship is not a place I would be comfortable working in for too long.

So I will probably not go to space any time soon.
